com.example.buber.DB

Class DBManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.buber.DB.DBManager

  • public class DBManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Repository for accessing firebase. Used to perform CRUD (Create, Read, Update Destroy) on our Firebase collections. Uses listeners to handle asynchronous reads/writes to Firebase.

    • Constructor Summary

      • createRider

        public void createRider(java.lang.String docID,
                        Rider rider,
                        EventCompletionListener listener)
        Create a rider document in Firebase. If it was not successful the listener passed in will handel the exception. If it was successful, the listener passed in will get the rider object. NOTE: The docID passed in is the same as the one used when a Firebase Authentication account was created
        Parameters:
        docID - the doc id of the user
        rider - an object of type rider
        listener - the listener that waits for the asynchronous Firebase call to finish

      • createDriver

        public void createDriver(java.lang.String docID,
                         Driver driver,
                         EventCompletionListener listener)
        Create a driver document in Firebase. If it was not successful the listener passed in will handel the exception. If it was successful, the listener passed in will pass get driver object NOTE: The docID passed in is the same as the one used when a Firebase Authentication account was created
        Parameters:
        docID - the doc id of the user
        driver - an object of type driver
        listener - the listener that waits for the asynchronous Firebase call to finish

      • createTrip

        public void createTrip(Trip tripRequest,
                       EventCompletionListener listener,
                       boolean listenForUpdates)
        Create a Trip document in Firebase. If it was not successful the listener passed in will handel the exception. If it was successful, the listener passed in will get the updates
        Parameters:
        tripRequest - the Trip object
        listener - the listener that waits for the asynchronous Firebase call to finish
        listenForUpdates - adds a snapshot listener if true

      • getRider

        public void getRider(java.lang.String docID,
                     EventCompletionListener listener)
        Get a rider object from Firebase. If it was not successful the listener passed in will handel the exception. If it was successful, the listener passed in will pass the rider object from Firebase to the listener. NOTE: The docID passed in is the same as the one used when a Firebase Authentication account was created
        Parameters:
        docID - the doc id of the user
        listener - the listener that waits for the asynchronous Firebase call to finish

      • getDriver

        public void getDriver(java.lang.String docID,
                      EventCompletionListener listener)
        Get a driver object from Firebase. If it was not successful the listener passed in will handel the exception. If it was successful, the listener passed in will pass the driver object from Firebase to the listener. NOTE: The docID passed in is the same as the one used when a Firebase Authentication account was created
        Parameters:
        docID - the doc id of the user
        listener - the listener that waits for the asynchronous Firebase call to finish

      • getTrip

        public void getTrip(java.lang.String docID,
                    EventCompletionListener listener,
                    boolean listenForUpdates)
        Get a Trip object from Firebase. If it was not successful the listener passed in will handel the exception. If it was successful, the listener passed in will pass the trip object from Firebase to the listener.
        Parameters:
        docID - the doc id of the user
        listener - the listener that waits for the asynchronous Firebase call to finish

      • getTrips

        public void getTrips(EventCompletionListener listener)
        Get all trip objects from Firebase. If it was not successful the listener passed in will handel the exception. If it was successful, the listener passed in will pass all the objects from Firebase to the listener in the form of a list.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener that waits for the asynchronous Firebase call to finish

      • updateRider

        public void updateRider(java.lang.String docID,
                        Rider updatedRider,
                        EventCompletionListener listener)
        Update a rider object in Firebase. If it was not successful the listener passed in will handel the exception. If it was successful, the listener passed in will return null once Firebase call ends
        Parameters:
        docID - the document id of the rider object that is being updated
        updatedRider - the rider object that will update the existing rider object in Firebase
        listener - the listener that waits for the asynchronous Firebase call to finish

      • updateDriver

        public void updateDriver(java.lang.String docID,
                         Driver updatedDriver,
                         EventCompletionListener listener)
        Update a driver object in Firebase. If it was not successful the listener passed in will handel the exception. If it was successful, the listener passed in will return null once Firebase call ends
        Parameters:
        docID - the document id of the driver object that is being updated
        updatedDriver - driver object that will update the existing driver object in Firebase
        listener - the listener that waits for the asynchronous Firebase call to finish

      • updateTrip

        public void updateTrip(java.lang.String docID,
                       Trip updatedTrip,
                       EventCompletionListener listener,
                       boolean listenForUpdates)
        Update a trip object in Firebase. If it was not successful the listener passed in will handel the exception. If it was successful, the listener passed in will get the updates
        Parameters:
        docID - the document id of the trip object that is being updated
        updatedTrip - object that will update the existing trip object in Firebase
        listener - the listener that waits for the asynchronous Firebase call to finish
        listenForUpdates - adds a snapshot listener if true

      • deleteRider

        public void deleteRider(java.lang.String docID,
                        EventCompletionListener listener)
        Delete a rider object in Firebase. If it was not successful the listener passed in will handel the exception. If it was successful, the listener passed in will return null once Firebase call ends
        Parameters:
        docID - the document id of the rider object that is being deleted
        listener - the listener that waits for the asynchronous Firebase call to finish

        Parameters:

        listener - the listener that waits for the asynchronous Firebase call to finish

      • deleteTrip

        public void deleteTrip(java.lang.String docID,

        Parameters:
